OOC: this didn't go out the first time around.

Delta was in the middle of the battle field.  In front he saw the ship, 
behind him was hills, to his left a forest, and to the right  an open field. 
  The sun was setting making the whole seen look like a picture.  The battle 
has taken it's toll on the land, blast holes and scorch marks on just about 
anything and every thing.  it was sad, why must so much be destroyed to 
change what will be so little.

the forest was smoking, but no fire was on heat sensors.  animals were 
running out of there bird flying and other smaller thing running and mother 
deer was laying on the ground, and it's cub nudging her to wake up.  But she 
wouldn't budge. the field covered in cared and burnt things, empty shells, 
broken pieces of armor, mech. fluid.  the hills were a carasy mix all every 
thing he has seen.  Fire, shells, armor, mech. fluid, and holes in the 
hills.  The ship was the worst of all.  metal pieces every where, the ship 
was on fire power was lost in some sections of the ship. holes, dents, more 
mech. fluid. it was the worst he's seen in a long while.

SO much caos, pain, suffering, anger, revenge, and even with all the bad 
emotions there was even hope, love, and sadness.  It was just too much to 
for his body to handle. In front, and behind, to the side, EVERY WHERE he 
look it was there it was just too much to handle.  Around, and around every 
thing was spinning.  Here, there, every where. And then it was all black.

�*static*.....Delta......Delta, come in....ANSWER ME SLAG YOU!.....MY ORDER 
WAS TO RETUNR TO BASE NOW GO!....out....*static�

�I must go�.� And with that Delta limped his way back to base.
